intro: Caleacte, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to the Americas but has been introduced to other tropical regions. Caleacte is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
